title: Third victim reportedly dies after Pawtucket ice rink shooting
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Gerald Dorgan, 75, died after being critically injured in a February 16 shooting at Pawtucket's Dennis M. Lynch Arena.
The shooter, Robert Dorgan, killed his former wife Rhonda Dorgan and their son before dying by suicide.
A GoFundMe is raising funds for survivors Ava Dorgan and a high school senior following the family's tragic losses.

title: Cat saved after days stuck in a tree following the blizzard that blanketed Rhode Island
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Matt Lyons climbed 40 to 50 feet to rescue Pixie, a gray and white cat stuck in a tree during Rhode Island's blizzard.
Stranded for nearly two days, Pixie was trapped 50 feet high with three feet of snow on the ground below.
Police, fire, and animal control were unable to assist, leading neighbors to seek help through the Nextdoor app.

title: 4 questions facing Bruins as they return from Olympic break
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Bruins will play 25 games in the final eight weeks of the 2025-26 NHL season.
The Bruins sit in the second Wild Card spot in the Eastern Conference with a 32-20-5 record.
Trade deadline decisions loom for the Bruins, with potential player deals influencing their playoff push.

title: Fire erupts at MCI-Norfolk prison, no major injuries reported
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: A fire broke out at MCI-Norfolk prison, the state's largest medium-security facility, on Wednesday afternoon.
Three incarcerated individuals were treated for smoke inhalation; one staff member required hospital evaluation as a precaution.
The cause of the fire is unknown and under investigation; officials are assessing damage and housing impacts.

title: Stephen A. Smith endorses Jaylen Brown as an MVP candidate
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Stephen A. Smith endorses Jaylen Brown as an NBA MVP candidate on ESPN's 'First Take'.
Jaylen Brown is averaging 29.2 points, 7.0 rebounds, and 4.9 assists per game for the Celtics this season.
The Boston Celtics are second in the Eastern Conference with a 38-19 record despite losing key players last offseason.

title: Harvard professor on leave as college investigates ties to Jeffrey Epstein
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Harvard Professor Martin Nowak is on paid leave amid investigation into ties with Jeffrey Epstein.
Epstein donated $6.5 million to establish Nowak's Program for Evolutionary Dynamics at Harvard in 2003.
Nowak visited Epstein's island in 2013 and Epstein had office and keycard access at Harvard's PED.

title: Malden educator, basketball coach charged with rape in incident involving high school student, officials say
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Scott Marino, Malden educator and basketball coach, charged with rape and other offenses involving a high school student.
Marino faces two counts of rape, indecent assault and battery, and supplying liquor to a minor, court records show.
Marino, placed on leave by Malden Public Schools, was arrested by Stoneham police; the case is overseen by Middlesex DA.

title: Red Sox’ Wilyer Abreu explains viral broken-bat check swing
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Wilyer Abreu's bat snapped during a check swing in a spring training game against the Pirates, leading to a viral moment.
Abreu, puzzled, mentioned a prior at-bat contact issue might have weakened the bat, despite not feeling any damage.
The Red Sox are looking for improved performance from Abreu, who hit 22 home runs last season despite playing only 115 games.

title: All Mass. customers should have power fully restored by end of Friday night, Eversource says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Eversource predicts all power outages in Eastern Mass. will be resolved by midnight Friday following a historic blizzard.
As of Wednesday, 160,000 Eversource customers were still without power, including 121,000 in Cape Cod and Martha's Vineyard.
Eversource workers from Canada, New Hampshire, and Ohio are working 18-hour shifts to restore power.

title: Team USA captain Hilary Knight reacts to Trump’s ‘distasteful’ joke about U.S. women’s hockey team
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Trump joked about the women's hockey team when inviting the men's team to the State of the Union.
Hilary Knight called Trump's comment 'distasteful' and overshadowing the women's team's success.
US women's team declined Trump's invitation citing prior commitments, despite his claim of future meetings.
